title: Paraguay: Citi, Avina and Red De Microfinanzas Launch 2016 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards
summary: Asunción, Paraguay - Citi announced the launch of the fifth annual Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, a project of the Citi Foundation in partnership with Avina and with the support of Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay.
tag-1: Paraguay: Citi, Avina and Red De Microfinanzas Launch 2016 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards
tag-3: Asunción, Paraguay – Citi announced the launch of the fifth annual Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, a project of the Citi Foundation in partnership with Avina and with the support of Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay.
tag-4: The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards are a global Citi program offered in approximately 30 countries around the world. To date, it has invested more than US$18 million in microfinance networks and institutions and awarded cash prizes to more than 6,000 microentrepreneurs in those countries, including Paraguay.
tag-5: The goal of the awards is to promote entrepreneurship by giving greater recognition to microentrepreneurs who play a fundamental role in the growth and sustainability of a sector estimated to account for more than 1.5 million businesses and approximately 66 percent of the country's labor force.
tag-6: "We are proud to be offering these awards for the fifth year, ensuring the continuity of a program supported by the Citi Foundation that invests in strengthening a sector of the national economy that contributes enormously to the development and well-being of so many families in Paraguay," remarked José Ignacio De Oteyza, Citi's Country Officer in Paraguay.
tag-7: Eduardo Rotela, head of Avina in Paraguay, emphasized the importance of entrepreneurship as a fundamental element in job creation and local economic development. One purpose of the awards, he pointed out, is to identify and reward innovative and successful microentrepreneurship projects that have had a significant impact on their communities.
tag-8: "Our experience and that of our partners in this strategically important sector is a determining factor in gaining recognition and rewards for success stories that can help inspire other potential microentrepreneurs," added Edith Perez, Executive Director of Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay.
tag-9: The award is designed for microentrepreneurs who have a credit history with local financial actors (banks, co-ops, microfinance institutions, organizations, etc.), which are the only ones that can nominate candidates. A judging panel made up of leaders and experts in the sector will evaluate the projects.
tag-10: The winners will receive recognition as well as cash prizes they can invest in expanding their businesses. Additional prizes will be given to the winners' credit advisors.
tag-11: In its first four years in Paraguay, the awards program has received more than 650 nominations from 25 different parts of the country. Close to 120 microentrepreneurs and their credit advisors have taken the Financial Education Seminar, and four of the winners have gone on to represent Paraguay in International Forums organized by Citi in Argentina, Costa Rica and Peru.
tag-12: For more information, please visit www.premioemprendedores.com.py.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-14: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi.
tag-15: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation works to promote economic progress in communities around the world and focuses on initiatives that expand financial inclusion. We collaborate with best-in-class partners to create measurable economic improvements that strengthen low-income families and communities. Through a "More than Philanthropy" approach, Citi's business resources and human capital enhance our philanthropic investments and impact. For more information, visit www.citifoundation.com.
tag-16: Avina Avina is a foundation that seeks to contribute to sustainable development in Latin America by promoting the establishment of links and partnerships between social and business leaders and articulating mutually acceptable action plans.
tag-17: Red de Microfinanzas de Paraguay Red de Microfinanzas de Paraguay is an umbrella organization for microfinance institutions in Paraguay. It is made up of organizations involved in the microfinance industry, including banks, finance companies, NGOs specializing in microcredit, and co-ops. Its mission and vision are to provide socially responsible leadership for microfinance policies, strategies and programs designed to improve quality of life for the country's microentrepreneurs.
